Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.

Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: 3. As a 1-credit course, the workload is certainly much lighter than 3-credit courses. It is roughly similar to, or maybe a bit lighter than, other 1-credit courses. 12. The class is useful as an introduction to negotiation, collaboration, and meeting facilitation theory. You also walk away with certain specific tips and insights that you can turn around and use in upcoming meetings & negotiations (or in everyday life).
Excellent course. Compact and well-taught.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Group simulations

Ona is very available, nice, and thoughtful - she tries to answer every question with a real-life example to illustrate her points. It was also nice to have three six-hour sessions - this led to bonding within the class and the ability to have breakout sessions to work through case studies.
The in-class exercises and discussions that followed.
Group negotiations Single-party Salary negotiations
1)professional relevance, 2)Ona's perspective, experience, and skills.
It was very interactive, and the material was absolutely relevant and useful.
The breakout sessions and group exercises.
In-class role-playing exercises.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The morning of the second session dragged a bit -- too much passive listening.
Incorporating readings into class discussion Scheduling -- consider breaking into six three-hour classes instead of three six-hour classes

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: N/A

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Regardless of what you're doing, it's useful to have some background in collaboration and negotiation. It helps to know how to deal with people and run meetings. This class is not life-changing (or even habit-changing), but it presents you with some good things to keep in mind as you move into pretty much any career path.
Will help me be more confident with salary and group negotiations in the future. Will help me be an effective meeting facilitator.
As an environmental manager, I will need to be able to negotiate between different stakeholders with conflicting value sets.
Communication skills for high-pressure situations. Also, salary negotiation tips.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Regardless of what you're doing, it's useful to have some background in collaboration and negotiation. It helps to know how to deal with people and run meetings.
I often find in professional environments that the "soft skills" like the ones taught in Ona's course are undervalued.
I've had to facilitate meetings in the past, and felt that my skills need improvement.
I took this course because I want to focus on environmental communication. Turns out, this class is absolutely necessary and relevant for everyone!
To improve my ability to problem solve with and between a diverse set of stakeholders.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Absolutely!
For the most part.
Yes.
Yes.
Yes! Great class. I learned how to engage in conversation and especially how to facilitate conversations.
Yes.
Yes. Gave me the basis to understand how to mediate effectively and taught perspective for negotiation situations.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Advantages: Group simulations imitated real life scenarios, in which people have to talk to each other. Disadvantages: Trying to schedule time outside of class to meet (though not much of a problem).
Very helpful to put teachings into actions during role-playing, especially in class. Difficult to coordinate one out-of-class assignment that involved 6 group members (scheduling conflicts).

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: It's a great 1-credit course and introduction to negotiation/facilitation (more on the facilitation side, though)
Go for it. It's a light workload and it gives you some good things to keep in mind as you go through F&ES and professional life.
Well worth sacrificing three Friday mornings
Take it. I don't think anyone who took the course regretted taking it.
It's an excellent course, but the skills learnt need to be regularly practiced and applied outside of class. The course only provides a very light introduction.
